comment.body: Personally, I do not. https://rationalwiki.org/wiki/Red_room

@Realjohndoe: I know you can change hubs (or even make your own) but that brings with it issues: e.g. after hitting my space limit on my original home hub, I just changed my hub, and now I can't see the message of mine that you replied to.
@Mew42: https://rationalwiki.org/wiki/Red_room
I have this in my Netflix list, as I noticed it stars Margaret Qualley, who was in [The Leftovers](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Leftovers_(TV_series%29), a great (scifi-ish?) series.

The other night I watched another Netflix sci-fi film [Annihilation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Annihilation_(film%29) which is also less about action and more about feeling. While I love sci-fi action, I found Annihilation to be great too.
@leftside: Well, hopefully the rest of the movie compensates for that :)
Here!
おはよう

Well, I saw IO last night. Good but not great, in my personal opinion. A couple of weeks ago I watched another Netflix-earth-is-dying-sci-fi movie, [The Titan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Titan_(film&29) which was ***awful***. IO was **much** better.
These films (especially Annihilation) have reminded me I need to find and watch **Сталкер** [Stalker](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Stalker_(1979_film%29)

Try visiting [ZeroSites](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Sites.ZeroNetwork.bit/?Home) & at top right "Filter" > PT + PT-BR to find ZeroNet sites in Portuguese.
Interesting read, but while you mention many potential benefits of democratizing these companies, you never say what that means. State ownership? Mutualization? Something else?

I think the way to avoid getting into trouble with copyright enforcers is not where you find the .torrent or Magnet URI (e.g. Play on ZeroNet) but how you use it (e.g. I2P). i2psnark is the main tool I believe, but BiglyBT also has a plugin for I2P.
+ https://thetinhat.com/tutorials/darknets/i2p.html (section 4)
+ https://privacytutorials.wordpress.com/2015/01/05/anonymous-torrenting-with-i2p-snark-using-snark/
+ https://www.reddit.com/r/i2p/search?q=snark&restrict_sr=1
Hi
26°C and sunny here in my secret location :)

@Red Liberty: I see now. I wonder what unintended consequences might need to be prevented by careful design, e.g. companies reducing headcount (e.g. through outsourcing) to concentrate voting power, or current electors becoming reluctant to hire because that would dilute their votes.
I remember dealing with some people at GE, and even though they were really full-time GE people, most of them technically worked for Manpower (temping agency) so that GE could get around various issues related to employee protection etc.
@Red Liberty: Synchronicity in action: just found this in my newsfeed  https://www.metafilter.com/179909/What-Are-We-Going-To-Do-About-The-State
I resent the assumption that I'm intelligent. ;)
Unfortunately on ZeroMe only the original post can contain an image; the comments can only contain text and link. So no image threads, I'm afraid.

Ice pick nitpick: an ice pick and an ice axe are two very different things. An [ice pick](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ice_pick) is a small kitchen utensil similar to a stiletto, for shaping or breaking up manmade blocks of ice. An [ice axe](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Ice_axe) is a large tool similar to a pickaxe (but not ice pick) used in mountain climbing in icy conditions.

A man gets on a London double decker bus and takes a seat. He then proceeds to tear up a sheet of paper into little pieces, and throws the pieces out of the back of the bus every few hundred yards/metres.
.
The other passengers notice this and are puzzled by it but say nothing. After a while of this going on, though, one finally screws up the courage and asks the man "Why do you keep throwing bits of paper out of the bus?"
.
"It keeps the elephants away," says the man matter-of-factly.
.
"But there *aren't* any elephants in London!" counters the surprised passenger.
.
And the man replies "See? It works!"

---

A cheesy joke I heard when I was a little kid but for some reason always remembered. It was *years* before I finally realized: "Oh yeah! It's all about the principle of '[correlation does not equal causation](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Correlation_does_not_imply_causation)'."

Have you tried adding your site on places like [ZeroSites](http://127.0.0.1:43110/Sites.ZeroNetwork.bit/), [ZeroCentral](http://127.0.0.1:43110/1Dt7FR5aNLkqAjmosWh8cMWzJu633GYN6u/) etc to help increase the number of peers?
Because one thread is never enough!!!
Hola

I'm not sure there is one, in the sense of Twitter being limited to 140/280 characters per message. I think it's more about the all-time data limit for you on your home hub, e.g. default is 100kb. After you hit your limit, your posts will be visible to you but not to others. That's why I moved to KaffieHub (limit 10MB).
.
And there are hubs with even more space: [see hub list on ZeroWiki](http://127.0.0.1:43110/138R53t3ZW7KDfSfxVpWUsMXgwUnsDNXLP/?Page:hubs)
meh

Some torrents/BT magnet links for TV are available on ZeroNet.
+ [TV Episodes](http://127.0.0.1:43110/tvepisodes.bit/) - Always updated list of torrents for mostly US TV shows broadcast in the last few weeks (does not save older torrents).
Chernobyl  s01e01 currently there but will be gone soon.
+ [Hot Buttered Toast](http://127.0.0.1:43110/15wupQiQssL2PnJVZymRRHozeB3w2YfUzv/) -  Updated site with various torrents/magnets, including TV shows. 
Personally the search function there never works for me, but maybe it will for you. The "What's Good" link there displays the latest torrents. "What's Good" doesn't currently seem to have Chernobyl (but does have a gazillion torrents for Game of Thrones right now.)

TV shows shared on ZeroNet itself:
+ [KopyKate](http://127.0.0.1:43110/18Pfr2oswXvD352BbJvo59gZ3GbdbipSzh/) is a YouTube-like video sharing site and has a lot of TV episodes, and more are uploaded all the time, but is not as current as TV Episodes.
Does not currently have Chernobyl.

You might have more luck with non-zeronet alternatives, like
+ Clearnet: [Torrentz2.eu](https://torrentz2.eu/search?f=chernobyl+s01e01)

Here's a post by @kaffie: about cjdns + 0net:
+ http://127.0.0.1:43110/1N6zp6jCXPBktNMPfe7UJBpQGyfCq7k2M8/?Post:51:Using+CJDNS+with+ZeroNet
ZeroMe is a social blogging network. Like Twitter or Weibo but without the character limit.
